clinical_study.brief_title: Shifting Salty Taste Preferences in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Salty Taste: Assessing a Strategy to Reduce Children's Preference

brief_summary.textblock: The goals of the proposed research are to determine whether repeated exposure to a low sodium food will result in reduced preference for salt in that food among children; and to determine whether such reductions in preference are related to dietary intake of salt, taste receptor genotype, and anthropometric and physiological measures.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a within- and between-subjects randomized controlled trial on children consuming either a low sodium or a higher sodium cereal over a 2-month period to determine if repeated exposure to the low sodium cereal is effective for reducing preference for salt in that food. Children will be genotyped for markers related to salty taste, dietary intake will be recorded, and anthropometric and physiological measures will be collected to determine if an association between any observed shift in salt preference and these measures exists.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline taste preferences for salt in cereal at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (time 0) and at end of intervention (12 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Change in most preferred level of salt taste . Concentration of salt most preferred will be measured by using a forced-choice psychophysical methods two times; immediately before the intervention (time 0) and then immediately after the intervention (12 weeks).

secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who shift taste preference based on taste genotype.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at end of intervention (12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be measured twice by using an automatic blood pressure machine with pediatric cuff. Blood pressure will be measured at baseline (time 0) and then immediately after the intervention (12 weeks) to examine associations between this measure and cereal preference.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at end of intervention (12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary recall using Automated Self-Administered (ASA) 24 software will be completed two times- at baseline (time 0) and then immediately after the intervention (12 weeks) to examine associations with taste preference and between groups.

arm_group.description: Children will receive regularly salted cereal to consume 4 times per week over a 2-month period.
Intervention: Children will receive low sodium cereal to consume 4 times per week over a 2-month period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- Willingness to consume no other cereals during intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergies and/or taking medication that affects taste
